lines.content: # I would like to join this list. How can I help the project
For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
* Sets up required objects, loads the data from the storage file.
* @param filePath Filepath to the text file.
* Sends welcome greeting and processes inputs.
super("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty/missing.");
super("OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty/missing.");
super("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
super("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means.");
* Represents the file storing the list.
* Default constructor for Storage given a filePath.
* @param filePath Filepath of where to load/save the data.
* Reads the data into the list.
* @throws DukeException If the file is unreadable.
* Writes the data into the text file.
* @param description The description of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Represents the parser to handle commands.
* @param taskList TaskList to edit the list.
* Method to add an item to the list.
* @param input Input to be added to the list.
* Method to delete an item from the list.
* @param input Input to be deleted from the list.
* Method to mark an item in the list.
* @param input Input to be marked in the list.
* Method to unmark an item in the list.
* @param input Input to be unmarked in the list.
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
* Copies contents of old list into new list.
* @param newArr the new arraylist to be copied into.
System.out.println(new DukeException("ERROR: there is no item in the list there!").getMessage());
System.out.println(new DukeException("ERROR: please specify an index.").getMessage());
* Method to show contents of list.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: \n" +
(TaskList.taskList.size() > 1 ? " tasks in your list." : " task in your list."));
(TaskList.taskList.size() > 1 ? " tasks in your list." : " task in your list."));
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:" + "\n" + "  " + TaskList.taskList.get(index).toString());
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + TaskList.taskList.get(index).toString());
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("This is a test description", "01-10-2000 1800");
assertEquals(deadline.toString(), "[D][ ] This is a test description (by: Sunday, 1 October 2000 6:00 PM)");
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("This is a test description", "01-10-2000 1800");
assertEquals(deadline.toString(), "[D][X] This is a test description (by: Sunday, 1 October 2000 6:00 PM)");
Todo todo = new Todo("This is a test description");
assertEquals(todo.toString(), "[T][ ] This is a test description");
Todo todo = new Todo("This is a test description");
assertEquals(todo.toString(), "[T][X] This is a test description");
